docs.summary: A text button or an icon button.
Sets or gets the label of a text button.
Gets an object containing information about the button's styles.
description: The following styles can be used with buttons:
Getting or setting a button's styles, gets or sets the styles of the
button's regular state. It does not set the styles of the button's hover

notes:
Not all styles can be used on all button designs. To determine which styles
 work with a specific button design, go to the **Button Design** panel in
 the Editor, choose a design, and click **Customize Design**. The design
 options that you see in the **Button Design** panel for your particular
 button are the styles you can use in your code.

relatedContent.text: Reacting to User Actions Using Events
How to Use Corvid with Marketing Tools to Create Custom Events
Importing and Exporting Collection Data with Code

FAQs.title: What style attributes can I control from code?
FAQs.markdown:
You can control the following style attributes using the button's [`style`](https://www.wix.com/code/reference/$w.Button.html#style) property:

*   [`backgroundColor`](https://www.wix.com/code/reference/$w.Style.html#backgroundColor)
*   [`borderColor`](https://www.wix.com/code/reference/$w.Style.html#borderColor)
*   [`borderRadius`](https://www.wix.com/code/reference/$w.Style.html#borderRadius)
*   [`borderWidth`](https://www.wix.com/code/reference/$w.Style.html#borderWidth)
*   [`color`](https://www.wix.com/code/reference/$w.Style.html#color)

FAQs.title: How do I prevent a button from being clicked multiple times?
FAQs.markdown: You can call the [`disable()`](https://www.wix.com/code/reference/$w.Button.html#disable) function inside the button's [`onClick()`](https://www.wix.com/code/reference/$w.Button.html#onClick) event handler. Subsequent clicks on the button will not be registered and the buttons [`onClick()`](https://www.wix.com/code/reference/$w.Button.html#onClick) event handler will not be called. You can call the [`enable()`](https://www.wix.com/code/reference/$w.Button.html#enable) function to allow the button to be clicked again.

FAQs.title: Is the 'onClick()' event handler called even when a button is disabled?
FAQs.markdown: No. You can call the [`enable()`](https://www.wix.com/code/reference/$w.Button.html#enable) function to allow the button to be clicked again.
